title: Peru: Citi Foundation Project Benefits 50,000 Rural Women Microentrepreneurs
summary: Lima - The Citi Foundation, via Citibank Peru, has partnered with the Consortium of Private Organizations Promoting Small and Microenterprise (COPEME) in a financial inclusion project that uses mobile, WAP and web technology to evaluate and approve loans for small and micro entrepreneurs in rural areas. Thanks to the initiative, a total of 101,284 women in agricultural zones have received service via the Experto Rural app.
tag-1: Peru: Citi Foundation Project Benefits 50,000 Rural Women Microentrepreneurs
tag-2: Lima – The Citi Foundation, via Citibank Peru, has partnered with the Consortium of Private Organizations Promoting Small and Microenterprise (COPEME) in a financial inclusion project that uses mobile, WAP and web technology to evaluate and approve loans for small and micro entrepreneurs in rural areas. Thanks to the initiative, a total of 101,284 women in agricultural zones have received service via the Experto Rural app.
tag-3: The program is part of Citi's support for Peruvian microentrepreneurs by co-financing the design and dissemination of innovative financial products that generate social and economic value.
tag-4: "As part of the Citi Foundation's goal to promote financial education and microfinance, Citibank Peru is trying to expand the frontiers of financial inclusion by incorporating greater numbers of rural women in the loan services financial companies offer," commented Monica Perales, Vice President for Human Resources and Public Relations at Citibank Peru.
tag-5: Beneficiaries are first evaluated via Experto Rural, a mobile app that produces a credit profile of applicants based on their national identity number.
tag-6: Between July 2012 and December 2013, the app received 134,686 credit history requests. Of these, 69,897 applicants went on to be approved for a loan. More than 72 percent of this group were women microentrepreneurs, most of them working in agriculture, livestock raising, textiles or small retail businesses.
tag-7: "We try to support initiatives that work collaboratively to realize entrepreneurial efforts and vocation in sustainable projects with the potential for future growth," Perales explained.
tag-8: Loans range from US$50 to US$3,000, with the average somewhere around US$380. The program is active in the regions of Lima, Cusco, San Martín, Puno, Ancash, Ayacucho, Huancavelica, Arequipa, Apurímac, Amazonas, La Libertad, Ucayali and Tacna, with growing involvement by microfinance institutions.
tag-9: The Citi Peru project draws on the support of the Citi Foundation's International Donation Program, which in 2013 alone invested US$76.5 million in more than 600 programs benefiting 1.1 million people in 90 countries around the world.
tag-10: Participating microfinance institutions that use the Experto Rural app include: Prisma, Adra Perú, Arariwa, CMAC Maynas, Crac Los Andes, Finca Perú, Fondesurco, Credimujer en Manuela Ramos, Microcrédito para el Desarrollo – MIDE and Promujer Perú.
tag-11: A number of government entities back the program, among them the Ministry of Social Development and Inclusion (MIDIS); the banking, insurance and pension authorities (SBS); and the Ministry of Foreign Relations, all signatories to the World Bank's Equal Futures Partnership.

tag-14: The Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
tag-15: Copeme The Consortium of Private Organizations Promoting Small and Microenterprise (Copeme) serves nearly 100 microfinance institutions in Peru, administering projects and providing consulting, market diagnostics, training, strategic information development, an assessment center, due diligence and relationships with loan and investment services through its Microfinance Unit. For more information, please visit www.copeme.org.pe or by contacting Carlos Ríos Henckell, head of the Microfinance Unit, at rioshenckell@copeme.org.pe.
